form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Leahy introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to ensure that the Department of Veterans Affairs provides temporary care in the most cost effective manner when patients are relocated during medical facility construction and renovation projects, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Transparency in Cost of Veterans Care Act of 2014
.

section.header: Improved accounting of major medical facility construction projects

subsection.text: Section 8104(b) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: Additional costs of providing hospital care or medical services resulting from temporary displacement of clinical space required by such construction, alteration, lease, or acquisition.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

In the case of a project that results in temporary displacement of clinical space, an analysis of any additional costs of providing hospital care or medical services resulting from such displacement, including additional costs associated with—

subparagraph.text: contracting with a non-Department facility in order to furnish hospital care or medical services;
the lease or purchase of a temporary or mobile medical facility.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to requests for funding of major medical facility projects and major medical facility leases submitted to Congress pursuant to section 8104(b) of such title on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
